content: turkish tiles a slip_stitch dishcloth… an original design by rebekah yeager 2014 this pattern came about as i was thinking about what pattern i would offer as a guest host in my weekly dishcloth group i wanted to be able to offer something that would look and feel good but also would have some personal significance to me since i am currently living in turkey i wanted to try and come up with something that would reflect something about the character of the place that i was living in at the same time i was introduced to using slip stitches and two colors to make a pattern this inspired me i could make my own pattern i decided to use the slip stich method of working with two colors to allow me to make a geometric pattern one that i hoped would remind me and others of floor tiles ceramics are ever present in turkey in both ceramic ware and tiles and the patterns and colors are delightful many apartment buildings have a tiled pattern strip running up the building copyright 2014 rebekah yeager all rights reserved reproducing or transmitting any or all pages of this pattern by any means and for any purpose other than personal use constitutes a violation of copyright law as you will see there are a good many row in this project and you do have to pay a little attention as you work the cloth the results however are worth it and i think a pair of these in reverse colors would make a stunning gift i have included charted patterns for a mug rug/ coaster dish cloth and tablemat all are made in the same way i have knitted this three times to test the pattern please let me know if you find any mistakes or need some help dishcloth group you have all been an important part in my settling in to this new country and keeping myself happy so cheers - this cloth is dedicated to you all materials size 6 needles two contrasting colors of cotton yarn i tested this with both i love this cotton and a sugar and cream/ lily and cream type yarn you will use less than a ball of each actually less than half a ball skills you need to be able to knit- there are no other special stitches you will create the pattern by skipping stiches and carrying your yarn across the back abbreviations k = knit sl = slip wyif = with yarn in front mc = main color cc = contrast color finished dimensions the end result is an attractively patterned dishcloth with a dense texture… sugar and cream = width 9 inches x height 9 ½ inches i love this cotton = width 8 ½ inches x height 9 ¼ inches instructions for dishcloth color one mc color two cc using mc cast on 49 stiches foundation row 1 knit all stiches foundation row 2 knit all stitches pattern body
